content.description: <math alttext="Z n solid, plus 2 H C l aqueous, reacts to produce, Z n C l 2 aqueous, plus H 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>HCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>â†’</mo><mtext></mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>ZnCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: When the reaction represented above proceeds, heat is produced. Which of the following best describes the reaction?

choices.label: It is a combustion reaction because heat is produced by the reaction.

It is a double replacement reaction because <math alttext="2 C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> atoms are added to <math alttext="Z n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Zn</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

It is an acid-base reaction because <math alttext="H C l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is an acid that is capable of exchanging <math alttext="H with a positive one charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.
It is an oxidation-reduction reaction because zinc is oxidized and hydrogen is reduced.

content.answer: It is an oxidation-reduction reaction because zinc is oxidized and hydrogen is reduced.
